(A) Evidence of Erosion: The creek silted badly after a rain. Silting came from logging road and dryland sort run-off.
(C) Water levels: Low water level in summer, but adequate during spawning periods.
(D) Spawning distribution: Pinks were mostly below hatchery site and almost all contained below logging road. Chum below hatchery.
(E) Comments on predators: Bears. This system has an active bear population.
(K) Additional comments: Coho begin arriving early at stream mouth. Subjected to heavy sportfish pressure and natural predators. A sanctuary boundary is needed to protect early stocks holding in estuary.
